data.text: @jwitker @OJJohnson81 @anti_putin_bot @lapublichealth They need to think again, because I know vaxxed people who’ve had ‘breakthrough’ infections and are still experiencing symptoms.  One has kidney damage (post Delta), two others have extensive fatigue & brain fog months later and one still has labored breathing.

@nasila8 @OJJohnson81 @anti_putin_bot @lapublichealth Inflammation isn’t from having virus in your nose/throat, it’s phase of hyper-immune response that occurs after >1 week of high viral load and hyper-immune response as naïve immune system tries to fight novel virus. Breakthroughs usually resolve as URI in a few days? https://t.co/xQrV7PwQWN

@nasila8 @OJJohnson81 @anti_putin_bot @lapublichealth I don’t that public health folks think that breakthrough cases will result in organ damage and T cell death because the vaccines prevent systemic disease — which causes those things — by limiting viral spread in host and clearing infection. Twitter amplifies misinfo.
@jwitker @OJJohnson81 @anti_putin_bot @lapublichealth Paywall. Does it address kids under 5  (all ineligible) and those unable to get vaxxed?

@jwitker @OJJohnson81 @anti_putin_bot @lapublichealth Again these are all numbers from acute infection, not systemic damage & inflammation caused by infection (& reinfection that will occur from lifting protections).

We don’t have enough data yet to know whether “breakthrough” cases result in organ damage, Tcell death, Long Covid.

@nasila8 @OJJohnson81 @anti_putin_bot @lapublichealth I don’t think it’s fully appreciated how much immune memory protects from severe effects, and how a “breakthrough” case is really different from a naïve infection even presenting as mild. 

See: https://t.co/TZWE3Ibvj5

@jwitker @OJJohnson81 @anti_putin_bot @lapublichealth I really, really hope he is right. I have a friend (with lupus, 3x vaxxed) who’s had Covid 3 times, she said each time it was worse. She’s still experiencing myriad Long Covid symptoms, most quite unpleasant.

@nasila8 @OJJohnson81 @anti_putin_bot @lapublichealth We get reinfected w/ pathogens for which we have adaptive immunity frequently, often w/o noticing? Repeat exposures to these viruses don’t cause chronic damage b/c immune system has tools to clear efficiently. Consider another T cell immunologist w/ 30 yrs exp. plus C19 research. https://t.co/CcUr6NJc8x

@nasila8 @OJJohnson81 @anti_putin_bot @lapublichealth I don’t think anyone seriously thinks that S-CoV2, a betacoronavirus, has a pathogenicity and/or mechanism that is similar to HIV? This seems like an unfounded fear. And if infection were causing widespread immune dysregulation, wouldn’t that be evident from clinical data? https://t.co/GobwcOlF9T
